jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

444F7CD0DDAF4E048A1C95314C832EA3.description:
Save and backup files on a
 computer hard drive, storage
 medium, or server.

1DF1C49AB5F648D9A3546B6B70672B9E.description:
Develop touch keyboarding
 techniques using both hands.

E5C8E01A38FA48CE85D6650DA436B3AD.description:
Â Discuss common uses
 of technology in daily
 life and the advantages
 and disadvantages
 those uses provide.
 *(5,6)

95D0F9D715774ED9BD3C48998C733B3E.description:
Use keyboards and other
common input and output
devices (including adaptive
devices when necessary)
efficiently and effectively.

EFD0BCFDE65B4C44BBED13193EC56CD7.description: Students demonstrate a sound understanding of technology concepts, systems, and operations. Students understand and use technology systems; select and use applications effectively and productively; troubleshoot systems and applications; transfer current knowledge to learning of new technologies.

83A1E9663D004FBAA451F8A2EDDFC26C.description:
Discuss security issues and
 procedures (i.e. passwords,
 privacy).

AA994D3CC6514F82A5E8620C4C04C171.description:
Discuss basic issues related to
 responsible use of technology
 and information and describe
 personal consequences of
 inappropriate use.

DE417D31B9F346DEB30BDC46CA96D0C2.description:
Discuss common uses of
 technology in daily life and the
 advantages and disadvantages
 those uses provide. *(5,6)

49B6AD2FD6F849749CDB0CA1437A66A2.description: Students understand human, cultural and societal issues related to technology and practice legal and ethical behavior. Students advocate and practice safe, legal and responsible use of information and technology; exhibit a positive attitude toward using technology that supports collaboration, learning and productivity; demonstrate a personal responsibility for lifelong learning; exhibit leadership for digital citizenship.

C455E193D0DA45629809153581E687E9.description:
Evaluate the accuracy,
 relevance, appropriateness,
 comprehensiveness, and bias
 of electronic information
 sources.

4540033808DB44D784CBD18E89874DD3.description:
Determine when technology is
 useful and select the
 appropriate tool(s) and
 technology resources to
 address a variety of tasks and
 problems. *(3,4)

AFDCAB56943B469E961D21C15C0FA739.description:
Use technology resources (e.g.,
 calculators, data collection
 probes, videos, educational
 software) for problem solving,
 self-directed learning, and
 extended learning activities.
 *(3,4)

77BC9D3C417940D5A12296335FEB7CEC.description: Students use critical thinking skills to plan and conduct research, manage projects, solve problems, and make informed decisions using appropriate digital tools and resources. Students identify and define authentic problems and significant questions for investigation; plan and manage activities to develop a solution or complete a project; collect and analyze data to identify solutions and/or make informed decisions; use multiple processes and diverse perspectives to explore alternative solutions.

1422ADCF340544839585F023815AC8B1.description: Critical Thinking, Problem Solving, and Decision Making

BAAE2EC7D89648149E2F6B3089DD9A1D.description:
Determine when technology is
 useful and select the
 appropriate tool(s) and
 technology resources to
 address a variety of tasks and
 problems. *(3,4)

9AB5B6969C0844DDACB77B2DB80ECBDD.description:
Use technology resources (e.g.,
 calculators, data collection
 probes, videos, educational
 software) for problem solving,
 self-directed learning, and
 extended learning activities.
 *(3,4)

C525649B38B1479DB95B58046F51A69F.description:
Use telecommunications and
 online resources (e.g., blogging,
 online discussions, Web
 environments) to participate in
 collaborative problem-solving
 activities for the purpose of
 developing solutions or
 products for audiences inside
 and outside the classroom.
 *(2,3)

8CF2AAF0E13744DCA654021D2091B024.description: Students apply digital tools to gather, evaluate and use information. Students plan strategies to guide inquiry; locate, organize, analyze, evaluate, synthesize, and ethically use information from a variety of sources and media; evaluate and select information sources and digital tools based on the appropriateness to specific tasks; process data and report results.

564EE2B1C03F4342A2B94B67DF41ACDB.description:
Â Identify and use simple
 search engines and
 directories.

062CABAF116E470399BD1866BE72A845.description:
Use telecommunications and
online resources (e.g., blogs,
online discussions, Web
environments) to participate in
collaborative problem-solving
activities for the purpose of
developing solutions or products
for audiences inside and outside
the classroom. *(2,3)

9DBD5759C6004A0DAB04167520F045BD.description:
Use telecommunications
efficiently and effectively to
access remote information,
communicate with others in
support of direct and independent
learning, and pursue personal
interests (e.g. use the functions of
a web browser to navigate and
save www sites).

6D5E9BEB87EF4C1F81752B8B30CBC2B1.description:
Use technology tools
 (e.g., multimedia
 authoring, presentation,
 Web tools, digital
 cameras, document cameras) for
 individual and
 collaborative writing,
 communication, and
 publishing activities to
 create knowledge
 products for audiences
 inside and outside. *(1,2)

036322034EFC4071B6275B62ACF1297C.description: Students use digital media and environments to communicate and work collaboratively, including at a distance, to support individual learning and contribute to the learning of others. Students interact, collaborate and publish with peers, experts or others employing a variety of digital environments and media; communicate information and ideas effectively to multiple audiences using as variety of media and formats; develop cultural understanding and global awareness by engaging with learners of other cultures; contribute to project teams to produce original works or solve problems.

B821DCBA4D1E436783FF44391A2F6050.description:
Use digital-imaging technology
 to modify or create a graphic.

ACE72BFEC95842E38FF28BCE33F83E26.description:
Identify and explain basic
 power point terms.

3EC6DA7B723646DCA3E713FDE654787A.description:
Describe the purpose and
 use of security applications.

D2B5E2FC17E047DC89F9A75DB3159F34.description:
Use a prepared spreadsheet
 template to enter and edit data
 and to produce and interpret a
 simple graph or chart.

4590C7D02CC3436E8ED460E3F33A9A58.description:
Identify and explain basic
 spreadsheet terms.

10F15B769632473695CC250FA42520EB.description:
Incorporate graphics, pictures,
 and sound into a document.

7AB26C4DAAD846F8BEAF32BB97CDBD41.description:
Â Produce and edit a word-
 processed document.

9ADF6EF54D54412EA7A4BF500168D1E0.description:
Identify and define basic word
 processing terminology (e.g.,
 cursor, open, save, file, I-
 beam, window, document,
 cut, copy, paste).Â

4E754445D1174BB5911016F37B74F54B.description:
Use technology tools
 (e.g., multimedia
 authoring, presentation,
 Web tools, digital
 cameras, scanners) for
 individual and collaborative
 writing, communication, and
 publishing activities to create
 knowledge products for
 audiences inside and outside
 the classroom. *(1,2,3,4)

68439D8E0A06407494A8533D83FA8ED1.description:
Use general purpose
 productivity tools and
 peripherals to support
 personal productivity,
 remediate skill deficits, and
 facilitate learning throughout
 the curriculum.

C4E59D25BE54436BAE60094A17C4E4A6.description: Students demonstrate creative thinking, construct knowledge, and develop innovative products and processes using technology. Students apply existing knowledge to generate new ideas, products, or processes; create original works as a means of personal or group expression; use models and simulations to explore complex systems and issues; identify trends and forecast possibilities.
